availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Blackwell Neal (Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy "Lucy" Neal. Father of Louisa Neal, Sarah E. Neal, Nancy Neal, John T. Neal, and W. H. Neal. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1850. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1860. Employed H. J. Sudduth as a farm hand in Bourbon County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 312B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 540-1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division, p. 635.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division, p. 126A.
"John B. Neal (1806-1888)," Find A Grave, Memorial #6353835, accessed May 23, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6353835.
